Module kline.qkmii.inventorymgmtsystem
Package kline.qkmii.inventorymgmtsystem.controller

Class MainMenuController

java.lang.Object
kline.qkmii.inventorymgmtsystem.controller.MainMenuController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class MainMenuController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
Controller class for the MainMenu FXML view. Handles button events for either Parts or Products tables. Table logic is handled by the nested controller DBTableController. Two references are stored to populate each table in the initialize method called by JavaFX. Button events that trigger a scene change are managed by SceneManager. Model objects that need to be passed between scenes are injected into the appropriate controller. Injection of the controllers to the corresponding FXML is managed by SceneManager. Dialog popups for feedback of button events are managed by DialogManager.

FUTURE ENHANCEMENT: Instead of changing the scene for the current stage (window), display a separate stage for each add/modify Part/ Product. This would allow the user to have a reference to the current inventory items (in main menu) while they are creating/ modifying an item so that the user does not accidentally duplicate information. Ideally, implement a proper database system (like with SQL) to make the inventory more robust. A login window would provide security to the data being accessed.

Author:
Timothy Albert Kline
